title: Are babies on average happier when being held by mom or by dad? - Quora

response.answer_text: If the father bonds with baby from birth, baby normally will be happy with either unless it’s feeding time and mom is breastfeeding. Some babies do get very attached to mom and only want mom. Others couldn’t care less who holds them. I have had both —our firstborn was very happy with her daddy holding her on his shoulder and walking. Our second wanted nothing to do with ANYONE except mom until he could walk and found out that following daddy outside was more interesting than being inside with mom. Third was also a mama’s boy until he could walk at 8 months and then preferred not to be held by anyone unless he was hungry, then I was allowed to hold him to nurse. He was extremely shy and wouldn’t talk to anyone else unless he got to know the person for a bit. The last kids were just happy to be with the family and didn’t care who held them!!

Babies are generally most happy when being held and spoken to by a calm and caring person. When they are a newborn, they are most familiar with the sound of their mother’s voice and her smell. Of course it helps that she is a ready source of warm milk if she is breast feeding. That does not mean that a fathers touch is not needed and enjoyed by the baby. Feeling secure, hearing a calm and reassuring voice and receiving a warm bottle of milk while you drift off to sleep, can be equally rewarding to an infant. Babies are very receptive to tense and uncertain care givers. As long as the babies basic needs for human contact, clean diapers, food and security, are met, there is no reason that either parent can necessarily outdo the other. Consistency is important.

It depends on the child. Our boys preferred mom hold them. Our baby girl preferred me. It's not that our boys didn't want me to hold them. When they were being fussy, they preferred mom. Our baby girl was the same way except she wanted me to hold her. Wifey and I met and married while in the Marine Corps. I was infantry, she was a finance clerk. I was out in the field a lot. When I came home our kids knew and wanted me to hold them. Like wifey said, “They liked your 'Sergeant’ voice rumble, it reassured them, daddy was home”.

In the beginning, assuming you’re asking about biological parents, babies are more comfortable with momma. They are accustomed to how she moves, breathes and her heartbeat. They have heard everything she said since they could while she carried them. If mom breastfeeds babies can smell breast milk a few feet away! But I’m referring to little babies. Once they become aware and social and daddy’s engaged too, babies tend to switch “favorites” and they will go back and forth between mom and dad.

Babies enjoy being held by someone who loves holding them. Some babies just don’t want held at all- it just seems to be in their nature. If one is uneasy and nervous while holding a baby, then that baby is going to pick up on that. By the same token, if you enjoy holding them and playing with them, they will most certainly pick up on that. This matters not if it is mum or dad. They love to be held by those who love to hold them.

No. Babies are happier being held in a comfortable position, gently rocking, or if hungry then being fed. Their current and past experience with the person holding them makes much more difference than the role outside of that. You have to remember that babies are still learning to form themselves at this point and do not have the background to even know what a mum or dad is.

I’d say mother, purely cos babies have a bond from the moment they are born, with their birth mother. Mine were taken away, supposively to be washed, for 10 minutes, they returned (twins) blood still in their hair so don’t know what happened whilst they were taken away, but still, then they were put in see through cots a distance from my hospital bed, I had an epidural so staff had to wait for the placenta to be released and checked etc it still made no difference. When I held them in my arms that gap in time was forgotten. So, for arguments sake, I would say mum.

Like any adult in their life, it depends on who they are most used to. They don’t understand gender or family roles. If a mom is breastfeeding, the baby may prefer her due to that smell but if daddy wears a shirt with her smell on it, that usually works fine. If dad is the primary care giver, the usually prefer him.

On average, they’re happy to be held by either. If a baby is breastfed, or the mum does most of the feeding, it can develop a closer relationship with its mum at this stage. However, as time does on, it balances out, especially if the dad spends a lot of time playing with and forming a bond with the baby.

As long as a baby feels safe with the way some one is holding them in general they just like being held,whether it is mum, dad or someone else.unless of course they want feeding and mum is breast feeding as opposed to bottle feeding, then there is only one person they want to be held by

Probably mother just because mother is the provider of the milk to the baby she has carried the child for 9 months and the child is used to her voice her heartbeats and her touch. Not that a child cannot learn to be soothed by the father butter I wouldn’t day newborns the mothers is more soothingly

It does not matter. Babies just like being held and cuddled and some prefer the left chest due to the heartbeat. Later on, the children may develop a bit temporary preference for that caretaker who is around more.

Babies love been held, no matter who. However as they grow girls tend to be more close to daddy and boys to mommy. In my family we have the same amount of girls and boys and we seen this pattern all the time.
It depends on the baby and if the momma holds him more often then the daddy and vice versa. It depends on how comfortably you hold it too. Babies don't like to be held really stiff like
I don’t really think they care as long as they are being snuggled and cuddled. Those that do notice are usually going with the parent who feeds them and tends them the most.
A infant baby doesn’t know the difference between love of a father and love of a mother. As long as they are each loving and taking care of the baby there is no difference.
Most babies only care about being held, but if it’s a breastfed baby, they are definitely happier in mom’s arms.
I think they just love being held by either parent.🙂
Since mom feeds them they would probably like mom best.
Babies are usually happy to be held by anyone, even someone who is not related to them as long as the person that is holding them has good vibes.
I guess it depends on the baby. And who is caring for him most of the time. Some babies prefer mom, some babies get enough of mom and preferred dad.
Moms feed babies so definitely they love to be held by moms more than dad's.
Babies are happy and secure while being held whether it's by mom or dad. Unless its feeding time it shouldn't matter which parent.
Depends on the baby and what the parent does as that is how you bond with your baby
Thanks for the A2A I think babies are happiest when being held by the person who takes care of them the most often.
